definition: to go all out/to work energetically
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: And while you've been absent, others have flourished.
sentences.chinese: 而就在你还没回过神来时，其他人已经大干快上了。

sentences.english: Jo's ambition was to do something very splendid.
sentences.chinese: 裘的志向是想轰轰烈烈地大干一番。

sentences.english: Virtue. in the great world, should be amenable.
sentences.chinese: 在这大干世界上，需要的是一种容人悔改的美德。

sentences.english: Gabriela Dabrowski, meanwhile, is thinking big.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，东布罗夫斯基正想着如何大干一场。

sentences.english: Mine leadership and the cadres and workers to watch a wonderful performance.
sentences.chinese: 该矿领导班子与广大干部职工一同观看了精彩的演出。

sentences.english: The mouth is so dry that it is difficulty for the patient to masticate and swallow food.
sentences.chinese: 口内大干，以致病人咀嚼和吞下食物，都有困难。

sentences.english: There are companies across India and China who say they are raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 印度和中国的制药公司都说他们渴望放手大干。

sentences.english: This is Whitman's for-real next big gig.
sentences.chinese: 惠特曼这次可是要真刀真枪地再大干一场。

sentences.english: These are the results that save broad cadre masses to try hard actively completely.
sentences.chinese: 这些是全省广大干部群众积极努力的结果。

sentences.english: Team was pumped to play chicago again, being an "up and coming team".
sentences.chinese: 球队再度碰到芝加哥公牛队，大家卯足了劲大干一番。

sentences.english: I can imagine the temptation was just to roll it out.
sentences.chinese: 我能够想象，大家很期待大干一场。

sentences.english: I'm going to play it if I can get somebody to go in with me.
sentences.chinese: 如果能有个人和我合伙的话，我准备大干一场。

definition: to throw off inhibitions/to go all out
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
real swords, real spears (idiom)/real weapons/very much for real/every bit real/the genuine article
in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
variant of 摩拳擦掌[mo1 quan2 ca1 zhang3]
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to work industriously/to get things done
